to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: How comes he does the monsters, I play the girlie ghosts?
sentences.chinese: 为什么怪物他来扮我就只能装这些女里女气的鬼魂？

sentences.english: The partisan disguised himself as a peddler and got by the enemy sentry box.
sentences.chinese: 游击队员扮小贩通过敌人的岗亭。

sentences.english: The criminal tried to grasp at a straw by feigning mental disorder.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯装疯扮傻，企图抓住一根救命稻草。

sentences.english: I squeezed her hand. And then grimaced.
sentences.chinese: 我抓紧她的手，然后扮了个鬼脸。

sentences.english: He speaks in a cutesy voice on behalf of the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他尖着嗓子娇滴滴的扮狗狗说话真是让我无语了。

sentences.english: The monoamines also play a role in rewiring the brain in response to new experiences.
sentences.chinese: 单胺类在新经验造成的脑部线路重组上，也扮有一角。

sentences.english: They look like models or actors playing a part.
sentences.chinese: 他们看上去像扮模特或在剧中扮演的一个角色。

sentences.english: At the circus, the clowns mopped and mowed.
sentences.chinese: 马戏演出时，丑角扮怪相。

sentences.english: No one can be the flash.
I told her to stop being lazy, cowardly, self-indulgent and pathetic.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉她抛开懒惰，懦弱，停止放任自己和扮可怜相。

sentences.english: CAI core and a small man look but eye, deliberately play fans require Monroes signature.
sentences.chinese: 蔡芯和小曼看不过眼，故意扮歌迷要求梦露签名。

to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
